snippet: A. O. Fox in Oneonta, N.Y., was still trying to figure out on Wednesday how its charges came to be so seriously underreported to the state.
abstract: Administrators at A O Fox Memorial Hospital in Oneonta, NY, are trying to figure out how bargain basement prices posted on interactive Web site came to be so seriously under-reported to state; some charges showing up on patient bills did not make it into state's main hospital data collection system, known as Sparcs, which was major source of cost figures in New York State Health Department's database.
lead_paragraph: A. O. Fox in Oneonta, N.Y., was still trying to figure out on Wednesday how its charges came to be so seriously underreported to the state.

headline.main: Bargain-Basement Prices at a New York Hospital Prove Too Good to Be True
headline.print_headline: Bargain Basement Prices at a Hospital Prove Too Good to Be True
